page.title: 04STRAWBERRIES PAST & PRESENT
page.content: THE GROWING OF STRAWBERRIES IN THE{ {CHEDDAR VALLEY}WAS STARTED IN THE 1860'S.THE RAILWAY LINE AND STATION IN {DRAYCOTT}VILLAGE HELPED TRANSPORT THE PRODUCE; AT IS HEIGHT THERE WERE FOUR SPECIAL TRAINS TRAVELLING TO { {SCOTLAND,}THE{NORTH,}THE {MIDLANDS}AND {BRISTOL.}IN 1985 THE RAILWAY LINE IS CLOSED, AND THE GROWERS HAVE TO RELY ON LORRIES TO TAKE THEIR STRAWBERRIES TO MARKETS ALL OVER THE COUNTRY. THE SOIL, ALTHOUGH VERY FERTILE, WILL BECOME EXHAUSTED, UNLESS IT IS RESTED, SOME GROWERS SEED GRASS, AND PUT COWS AND SHEEP ON THEIR FALLOW LAND, OTHERS ARE TRYING TO DIVERSIFY AND GROW OTHER PRODUCTS SUCH AS LETTUCE, RASPBERRIES, BLACKCURRANTS AND LOGANBERRIES. ALSO FIELDS HAVE BEEN OPENED TO THE PUBLIC FOR 'PICK-YOUR-OWN',AND NEW STRAINS OF STRAWBERRIES ARE BEING TRIED.
